item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。发展中国家--尤其是印度--应该学习孟加拉国公开、务实的尝试，防止这种情况发生👇。
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Developing countries—especially India—should learn from Bangladesh’s open, pragmatic attempts to prevent this from happening https://t.co/epysLIssb8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 作为英国最受欢迎的海滨度假胜地，黑潭给数百万人带来了欢乐。然而，它也是一个令人绝望的地方，在多项指标上都在全国排名垫底👇。
item.description:
As Britain’s most popular coastal resort, Blackpool brings joy to millions. Yet it is also a repository of despair, at the bottom of national rankings on a host of measures https://t.co/tn8Vh1cbUk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 习近平正在扮演社会工程师。我们的中国专栏作家带您了解中国共产党的文明习惯传播活动👇。
item.description:
Xi Jinping is playing social engineer. Our China columnist takes a look inside the Communist Party’s campaign to spread civilised habits https://t.co/0jfJ92O18w 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 中国的虚假研究猖獗。但 11 名学生希望树立更好的榜样 👇
item.description:
Fake research is rampant in China. But eleven students want to set a better example https://t.co/gEs81U8Uxh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 随着追求健康的年轻人对老式古董酒的回避，模拟鸡尾酒在全球范围内风靡一时。不过，在沙特阿拉伯，最近流行的一种鸡尾酒预示着另一种社会变革👇。
item.description:
Mocktails are having a moment around the world, as health­-crazed young people shun old­-fashioned old fashioneds. In Saudi Arabia, though, a recent mocktail buzz signals a different sort of social change https://t.co/Jc266rkUUx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：乌克兰战争两周年特别节目。未来 12 个月会发生什么？收听每日播客： 👇
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: a special episode marking two years of war in Ukraine. What will the next 12 months hold? Listen to the daily podcast: https://t.co/coz8AhD9S5 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 世界正在目睹一场前所未有的金融战争。但就在西方加紧制裁的同时，规避制裁的方法也变得越来越复杂 👇。
item.description:
The world is witnessing an unprecedented surge in financial warfare. But just as the West ratchets up sanctions, ways to circumvent them are becoming more sophisticated https://t.co/GqWziqAYS1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 自 2016 年以来，秘鲁已成为不稳定的代名词。然而，其货币索尔长期以来一直是南美洲最坚挺的货币。阿根廷总统可以从中吸取教训： 本-希基
item.description:
Since 2016 Peru has become a byword for instability. Yet its currency, the sol, has long been the most solid in South America. There are lessons in this for Argentina’s president: https://t.co/kW4GW8wSrK

Illustration: Ben Hickey pic.twitter.com/uc7CgDe0st

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 全球最大的眼镜制造商希望成为一家科技公司。它正在尝试智能眼镜和内置助听器👇。
item.description:
The world’s biggest maker of spectacles wants to be a tech firm. It is experimenting with smart glasses and built-in hearing aids https://t.co/gr12iuqpUZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: "巴德尔-阿尔布赛义迪在一篇特邀文章中写道："哈马斯是无法根除的。"无论死多少激进分子，他们的事业都将继续存在。他认为，如果要实现和平，和平缔造者就必须找到与他们对话的方式--而且要倾听他们的声音
item.description:
“Hamas cannot be eradicated,” writes Badr Albusaidi in a guest essay. “Their cause will be kept alive however many militants die.” He argues that if there is ever to be peace, the peacemakers have to find a way to talk to them—and to listen https://t.co/YIIXzeUaf1

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 美国陆军的未来在欧洲还是亚洲？它不可能同时在欧洲和亚洲发动战争 👇。
item.description:
Does the US Army’s future lie in Europe or Asia? It could not wage wars in both at the same time https://t.co/bBw2pZww8W 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: ♦️ 查克-舒默访问乌克兰，为援助提供支持。♦️ 尼基-黑莉在自己的主场陷入困境。♦️ 民主党人谴责一项称胚胎为儿童的裁决。关注美国政治最新动态： 👇

♦️ Chuck Schumer visits Ukraine to bolster the case for aid.

♦️ Nikki Haley struggles on her home turf.

♦️ Democrats denounce a ruling that says embryos are children.

Follow the latest in American politics: https://t.co/kFuoryxRTr 👇 pic.twitter.com/qmEG0Lo6Ai

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 不要指望美国利率会下降。第二波通胀的风险目前仍然太大 👇
item.description:
Do not expect America’s interest rates to fall yet. The risk of a second wave of inflation remains too great for now https://t.co/9IHatrTAgH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 最近的一篇研究论文指出，由一半美国股票和一半全球股票组成的 100% 股票投资组合很可能会击败分散投资的方法。但这一论点与长期以来的主流建议背道而驰👇。
item.description:
A portfolio of 100% equities, made up of half American and half global stocks, is likely to beat a diversified approach, according to a recent research paper. But that argument flies in the face of longstanding mainstream advice https://t.co/n5qDiGEzjA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 塞内加尔宪法委员会要求政府 "尽快 "举行选举。总统已承诺这样做。这在实践中意味着什么，一直备受争议👇。
item.description:
Senegal’s Constitutional Council has told the government to hold an election “as soon as possible”. The president has promised to do so. What that means in practice has been hotly contested https://t.co/6NxaNCT9X8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 大多数以色列人接受他们的军事义务--以及延长征兵期限的建议--认为这是必要之恶。但他们希望看到征兵的负担得到更平等的分担👇。
item.description:
Most Israelis accept their military obligations—and their proposed extension—as a necessary evil. But they would like to see the burden of conscription shared more equally https://t.co/987EEDJFkb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 暗物质是科学界最大的谜团之一。研究人员如何才能探测到无法探测到的？收听我们的 "巴贝奇 "播客 👇
item.description:
Dark matter is one of science’s greatest mysteries. How can researchers detect the undetectable? Listen to our “Babbage” podcast https://t.co/BBiqhggNPm 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 由于 "3-23 "运动叛军包围了戈马，出城的唯一道路是越过边境通往卢旺达。然而，这并不是什么生命线，因为刚果的邻国对当前的危机负有主要责任，而这场危机有可能爆发为一场全面的地区战争
item.description:
As M23 rebels surround Goma, the only road out of the city leads across the border to Rwanda.

Yet that isn’t much of a lifeline, since Congo’s neighbour is largely responsible for the current crisis, which risks exploding into a full­-blown regional war https://t.co/KPyoDIVA7R

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 西方正在转向次级制裁，以削弱俄罗斯和支持乌克兰。从长远来看，这将削弱美国对全球金融体系的影响力👇。
item.description:
The West is turning to secondary sanctions to weaken Russia and support Ukraine. In the long term this will erode America’s sway over the global financial system https://t.co/7yX13Jxhtq 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 试图给唐纳德-特朗普定罪的检察官面临着一个极不寻常的最后期限。然而，那些希望看到他在选举日前被关起来的人将会失望： KAL
item.description:
The prosecutors trying to convict Donald Trump face a highly unusual deadline. Yet those who wish to see him locked up by election day will be disappointed: https://t.co/ccWiyaY8PF

Illustration: KAL pic.twitter.com/SMn1QAisXs

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 雷达天文学家正在游说开发一种功能强大的新工具，以便跟踪和了解离地球最近的小行星--尤其是有朝一日可能撞击人类母星的小行星 👇。
item.description:
Radar astronomers are lobbying for a powerful new tool that would be able to track and understand the asteroids nearest Earth—especially any that might one day hit humanity’s home planet https://t.co/LDVNYopOgP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: ♦️ 民主党人谴责阿拉巴马州最高法院关于胚胎是儿童的裁决。♦️ 乔-拜登会见了阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的遗孀和女儿。♦️ 最新民调显示，民主党在亚利桑那州参议院竞选中占据优势。关注美国政治新闻： 👇
item.description:

item.title: 为什么地处内陆的埃斯瓦提尼有船舶注册处？像它这样的国家可能会助长 "黑暗船队 "的发展 👇
item.description:
Why does landlocked Eswatini have a ship registry? Countries like it may be helping to fuel the growth of a “dark fleet” https://t.co/54JsCs7Oqc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: Could a cure for type-1 diabetes be on the horizon? Here’s how lab-grown, genetically modified beta cells could offer a step in the right direction: 👇

Could a cure for type-1 diabetes be on the horizon? Here’s how lab-grown, genetically modified beta cells could offer a step in the right direction: https://t.co/09dNPcYWz8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 新的证据显示，克里姆林宫的情报机构已经从过去两年的错误中吸取了教训 👇...
item.description:
Russian spies are back—and more dangerous than ever.

New evidence shows that the Kremlin’s intelligence agencies have learned from their mistakes over the past two years https://t.co/VbklLSuRcZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 在整个 2010 年代，美国独角兽公司（估值超过 10 亿美元的私营公司）的数量激增。2021 年，独角兽公司的数量达到了 344 家。现在是悼念独角兽的时候了吗？ 🦄
item.description:
Throughout the 2010s the number of unicorns—private companies with valuations above $1bn—soared in America. Fully 344 of them were minted in 2021. Last year’s ﬁgure was 45.

Is it time to mourn the unicorn—or will they not be all that missed? https://t.co/PTR6dg0RR2 🦄

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，刚果东部一直受到邻国的干涉和争夺，世界上很少有地方像刚果东部这样长期遭受苦难。但外界很少有人关注该国正在发生的危机 pic.twitter.com/BuLzI6xDBV
item.description:
Few parts of the world have suffered such prolonged misery as eastern Congo, a place that has been meddled in and fought over by its neighbours for decades. But few in the outside world are paying much attention to the unfolding crisis in the country https://t.co/ijpDEJQCph pic.twitter.com/BuLzI6xDBV

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 2022 年俄罗斯入侵乌克兰时，索菲娅、尤利娅和阿利西亚才 15 岁。@pollybraden 在战争爆发后不久遇到了她们，两年来，这位英国摄影师一直与她们保持着密切联系，记录下了她们曲折的旅程
item.description:
Sofiia, Yuliia and Aliesia were 15 when Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022. @pollybraden met them shortly after the war broke out, and for two years the British photographer has kept in close contact, capturing the twists and turns of their journeys https://t.co/2AvPQqD7zU

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024

item.title: 去年，我们的 "Carrie Bradshaw 指数 "发现，纽约是美国个人租房最昂贵的城市。我们不禁要问，在欧洲，有抱负的 Carries 能在哪里住得起呢？ 👇
item.description:
Last year our Carrie Bradshaw index found that New York is the most expensive city in America for solo renters. We couldn’t help but wonder, where could aspiring Carries afford to live in Europe? https://t.co/etsNbK7oeg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 23, 2024
